description: Osun state, Nigeria, announced April 2 that the governor has signed the Osun Infectious Diseases (Emergency Prevention) Regulations 2020. Under the law transmission or dissemination of false information regarding Covid-19 is an offense and anybody who violates the law will be sentenced to six-month imprisonment or an option of fine upon conviction.
type: Anti-Disinformation Measures
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On April 16, Kogi State Governor, Alhaji Yahaya Bello has denied ever trivialising Covid-19 pandemic as untrue, political and an avenue for corrupt public officials to enrich themselves as claimed in recent social media reports. He is urging the public and good people of Kogi State to disregard the said fake news churned out by agents of mischief whose stock in trade is to mislead the people and cause disaffection in the society.
type: Anti-Disinformation Measures
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

He is urging the public and good people of Kogi State to disregard the said fake news churned out by agents of mischief whose stock in trade is to mislead the people and cause disaffection in the society.
type: Anti-Disinformation Measures
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On May 15, Kwara State Governor, AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq, said the man in a recent video that went viral on social media was not a suspected COVID-19 patient. The governor, who disclosed this during a visit to the state’s isolation centre in Ilorin, however, told journalists that the man was inappropriately evacuated from his home in Ilorin.

description: On June 16th, 2020, Nigeria conducted training of health reporters and journalists on factual reporting on COVID-19 in Kano State. The primary goal was to prevent the spread of fake news surrounding COVID-19 and its status in the country. The non-governmental organization "Breakthrough Action-Nigeria" as well as the Federal Ministry of Health conducted the training in order to help reporters and journalists identify scams, fabricated information, and conspiracy theories, among other issues, before proliferating information and sources.
type: Anti-Disinformation Measures
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

The primary goal was to prevent the spread of fake news surrounding COVID-19 and its status in the country. The non-governmental organization "Breakthrough Action-Nigeria" as well as the Federal Ministry of Health conducted the training in order to help reporters and journalists identify scams, fabricated information, and conspiracy theories, among other issues, before proliferating information and sources.
type: Anti-Disinformation Measures
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Nigeria, june 26 - a recent collaboration of the Borno State Government with the World Health Organisation to launch a campaign tagged ‘COVID-19 Heroes Campaign’ launched on May 29 in Borno State.The deputy governor noted that the campaign was aimed at demystifying COVID-19 and putting a stop to the stigmatisation of those affected by the pandemic, adding that sufferers of the disease should be celebrated by all rather than stigmatised.

description: The Anambra State Government of Nigeria announced on July 13, 2020 that they were aware of a group of criminals parading in fake Covid-19 Task Force uniforms. These criminals had been arresting people and extorting huge sums of money from them while posturing as working for the government of Anambra State. The government indicated that the only agencies authorized to enforce the Anambra State Covid-19 Law are the members of OCHA Brigade and ATMA. Additionally, the government warned these fake operators that the Anambra State Police Command has been directed to search for, arrest and prosecute anybody masquerading as a Covid-19 Task Force operator.
type: Anti-Disinformation Measures
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

Present at the meeting are the governors of Katsina, Zamfara, Sokoto, Jigawa, Kebbi, Kaduna, and Niger States, while Kano deputy governor Nasiru Gawuna represented governor Umar Ganduje. The closure will take effect from Monday 23rd of March 2020. On 28th of March Governor Atiku Bagudu of Kebbi state also ordered that all schools including Islamiyya and Almajiri Schools should remain closed till further notice. UPDATE: Originally th epolicy for school closure was limited to 30 days but on 28th of March the governor of Kebbi state changed to an indefinite date. Also, religious schools have to close as well.

description:
Lagos state government closes all public and private schools from 23rd March.
After closing schools since march, Lagos state government on the 29th of July asks HER SS3 and TEC3 to resume on 3rd of Aug, in order to prepare for their West African Senior Secondary Certificate Exams. UPDATE: The Lagos State government has previously directed that all primary, secondary and tertiary institutions should be closed due to the pandemic on the 23rd of May. However, on the July 29th the commissioner of education announced that all the SS3 and Technical Studies (TEC3) students in both day and boarding schools in the state are to resume on Monday, August 3, 2020, to help them prepare for the forthcoming West Africa Senior Secondary Certificate Examination (WASSCE).
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description:
Lagos state government closes all public and private schools from 23rd March.
After closing schools since march, Lagos state government on the 29th of July asks HER SS3 and TEC3 to resume on 3rd of Aug, in order to prepare for their West African Senior Secondary Certificate Exams. UPDATE: The Lagos State government has previously directed that all primary, secondary and tertiary institutions should be closed due to the pandemic on the 23rd of May. However, on the July 29th the commissioner of education announced that all the SS3 and Technical Studies (TEC3) students in both day and boarding schools in the state are to resume on Monday, August 3, 2020, to help them prepare for the forthcoming West Africa Senior Secondary Certificate Examination (WASSCE).

description: Osun state, Nigeria reopens school on August 4 for exit students with following guidelines: Parents are expected to provide face masks/nose covers for their children or wards, while Principals and Proprietors of Schools are expected to ensure a tidy environment with desks arranged at least two meters apart. This social distancing  shall be ensured by Class Wardens. Also, The Ministry of Education shall provide buckets, soap, hand sanitizers, thermometer and also fumigate all schools. The Ministry of Health shall also provide Vitamin C tablets for students. NCDC or the Ministry of Health should be alerted in case of any sign of infection in any of the schools. Preschool, Primary schools and higher education institutions are still closed.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description: On April 10, Kwara State Governor AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq has announced that they refurbished the state’s oxygen plant, over nine years after it last functioned at usable capacity. The revamped facility bolsters Kwara’s capabilities to manage Coronavirus (COVID-19) patients who may require ventilators for a lifeline. The Governor also commended the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) for helping the state to recover looted funds which have become useful in the campaign against COVID-19. AbdulRazaq said the recovered funds strengthened Kwara’s ability to put in place necessary facilities, among other counter-COVID-19 efforts. The Governor said the government has turned around the Sobi Specialist Hospital which is now the COVID-19 response center of the state. The administration is now working on having an isolation centre in Offa after which another would be created in General Hospital Kaiama. They had bought five new ambulances (three on the ground and two are on the way) and a mobile x-ray machine. They have also 10 ventilators now and they expect to have 30 by the end of the month.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: On July 4, The Kwara State government has announced the receipt of N243m as financial donations from private individuals and corporate bodies between March 27th and July 4th. These expenses covered the purchase of military grade Toyota Land Cruiser Ambulances; automated ventilators and several other Intensive Care Unit (ICU) gadgets/equipment; production of hand sanitizers; and the cost of running the activities of the technical committee and its subcommittees, the statement reads. The expenses also covered the cost of the palliatives that were distributed during the lockdown; renovation of the Sobi Specialist Hospital and the Hajj Camp; mass production of face masks, purchase of surgical masks, digital thermometers, N95 and respirator-sperien 5311 and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE). Others are; medical supplies and consumables; security expenses; training; allowances for medical personnel and other supportive staff in charge of the pandemic; part-renovation of the Offa General Hospital as an isolation centre; and patients’ management, among others.

description: On Friday, July 24th, the Nigerian Government conducted training for 50 TB/HIV/ COVID-19 coordinators on basic Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) practices in Kano State. IPC practices include ensuring early triage, recognition, and source control at the point of entry to a facility, the implementation of hygienic precautions for all patients within facilities, the proper use and disposal of all PPE, and proper social distancing of patients as well as proper ventilation for all facilities housing known COVID-19 patients. Specific precautions vary depending on the type of facility (e.g. patient room, laboratory, waiting/holding room, etc.)

description: On July 6, Edo State Government said no fewer than 201 health workers have tested positive for coronavirus disease (COVID-19) since the outbreak of the pandemic in the state. They said that a total of 201 health workers have tested positive to the virus since the outbreak of the pandemic in the state. The government will not relent in ensuring the welfare of the state’s health workforce as well as continue to intensify efforts to contain the pandemic across communities in the state and protect Edo people. Meanwhile, Edo House of Assembly has adjourned plenary indefinitely following the result of a second confirmed case of the pandemic in the complex. Speaker of the House, Frank Okiye, said the adjournment was to enable lawmakers and workers of the assembly to undergo COVID-19 test.

description: On April 10, Kwara State Government has announced total lockdown of the state. The new measure banned all vehicular movement, including private vehicles, all manners of shops and markets. Food sellers and operators of medicine stores are allowed to operate on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays between 10a.m. and 2p.m. All health workers remain exempted from this lockdown. Kwara Farmers who can identify themselves with any registered farming associations are allowed to go to their farms during the total lockdown the government has declared to prevent the spread of Corona Virus in the state. The Kwara State Technical Committee on COVID-19 also exempted journalists on duty from the lockdown in line with global best practices during such emergencies.  It is also to be noted that previous waivers to manufacturing firms are still valid on the condition that they maintain social distancing and scale down their operations. Petrol stations, banks, and hospitals are also exempted from the lockdown on the condition that all safety protocols are adhered to.
type: Lockdown

These smaller teams would be comprised of the Officer-in-Charge of Primary Healthcare Center, the Community Woman Leader, the Community Youth Leader, the Representative of the Ministry of Health and the Representative of the Civil Society. The teams would be headed by the Councilor of the Ward, but the Local Government Chairman and his Medical Team shall supervise the activities of the entire Team. This new structure is intended to help ramp up testing in local communities.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: Nigerias Anambra State Government announced on June 2 2020 new protocol for the sampling and reporting of COVID19 cases According to the announcement all members of the Nigerian Medical Association practicing in Anambra State were hereby expected to inform the Ministry of Health once they collect samples of suspected Covid19 patients for testing This is in order to ameliorate a prior issue of members collecting samples and sending them to the testing centers on their own All Covid19 efforts in Anambra State with regards to the collection of samples and the presentation of specimen to NCDC must be centralized going forward
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On April 28, The Edo State Governor, Godwin Obaseki has launched an online homeschooling platform, EDO-BEST@Home, which enables pupils learn from resources downloaded from an online database while at home. Obaseki said the platform is part of steps taken by the state government to ensure academic engagement by students, who ought to have resumed for a new term on April 27, but would have to remain at home as a result of the partial lockdown imposed to check the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. The platform supported by State Universal Basic Education Board (SUBEB), MTN Nigeria also benefiting from a strong alliance between the government, the private sector, and the World Bank. The state is also developing interactive quizzes delivered to parents’ mobile phones to maximize the interaction between learners and teachers.

description: on June 27th, 2020, The Rivers State Executive Council has approved Guidelines for Marraiges/Weddings in the state during the period of Covid 19.
type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: The Rivers State Executive Council has approved Guidelines for Marraiges/Weddings in the state during the period of Covid 19.  Prospective Couples would need to get an approval/ apply to the Governor through the Commisioner for Social Welfare.  All Weddings/Marraiges have an attendance limit of 50 people.  The names, addresses and phone number of all attendees made available with the application (To enable quick contact tracing if the need arises).  Soap and running water has to be kept at the entrance to the venue in not less than three places while all attendees are to wear face masks and maintain social distancing of not less than 2 meters.  Church weddings are to be conducted between 9am and 12noon, while traditional weddings are to be conducted between 4pm and 7pm.  A representative of the Ministry would be present to observe the event.  A fine of N10,000,000 is to be paid by anyone that puts people at risk by breaking this regulation.

description: The Katsina State Government of Nigeria advised its citizens that travelers returning back home from abroad, especially from countries where confirmed cases of COVID-19 had been made, should be on self-quarantine for 14 days. This was announced on March 23, 2020.

type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: The Anambra State Government of Nigeria announced on March 23, 2020 that all persons returning to Anambra State from all countries of the world and states that have Covid-19 cases must report and then go into self-isolation (quarantine) for 14 days.
type: Quarantine
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On March 24, Kwara State Governor AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq said that Kwara state currently has no confirmed case but the government he has set up various preventive and safety mechanisms, including establishing and equipping an isolation centre, to tackle the virus in the state.
type: Quarantine
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: Nasarawa state, Nigeria, on March 24 urges individuals who had recently returned from foreign trips to observe self isolation for the period of 14 days.
type: Quarantine
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: The Edo Government said that they have discovered that some returnees use hotels as isolation centres and said it is no longer acceptable. Those who are even isolating themselves at home do not adhere to the rules so it is banned with effect from April 6. Only the four designated isolation centres in Auchi general hospital in Edo North, Irrua Specialist Hospital in Edo Central, University of Benin Teaching Hospital (UBTH) and Stella Obasanjo hospital in Edo South will be used from now on.
type: Quarantine
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: Nasarawa state, Nigeria, announce that from April 20 all indigent returnees would be quarantined for 14 days.

type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On April 21, the state of Gombe in Nigeria recommended a need for a quarantine center in NYSC temporary orientation camp for all people coming into the state to be restricted for 14 days before being allowed entry.
type: Quarantine
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: Abia Government on Friday, April 24, said it had traced 209 contacts of the two index coronavirus cases in the state and placed them under surveillance in an isolation facility.

description: The Anambra State Government of Nigeria announced on May 1, 2020 that families accompanying corpses home to Anambra after the lifting of lockdown must self-isolate for 14-days following their traveling with the body. This is to prevent the spread of COVID-19 throughout Anambra.
type: Quarantine
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On May 7, Governor Yahaya Bello of Kogi State has ordered officials of the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) who visited the State to go into a 14-day isolation at the state’s quarantine centre.

description: On 15 May, the Kwara State Government’s intelligence network uncovered a plot by some COVID-19 patients who sneaked into the state to escape. Security has been further beefed up at the isolation centre.
type: Quarantine
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On May 15, The Kwara State governmen has foiled a move by some COVID-19 patients who attempted to escape from the Ilorin isolation centre after testing positive for the virus. Rafiu Ajakaye, spokesman of the state COVID-19 technical committee who revealed this in a statement on Friday, said that the attempted escape by the patients was promptly foiled leading to the arrest and return of the patients to the isolation centre after they had already scaled the fence.
type: Quarantine
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 23, Cross River state government directed civil servants, except those on essential services (medical personnel and revenue officers), to stay away from work for two weeks, beginning immediately.

UPDATE: On April 6, Cross River state government extended the stay at home order for non-essential civil servants for one week. UPDATE: The original stay at home order for non-essential civil servants was set to last until April 6, it has been extended to April 14.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: The Borno State High Court of Justice, Nigeria, has suspended sitting from March 24 until April 13, over the outbreak of Coronavirus pandemic in the country.  The vacation judge of the High Court, the Chief Magistrate Court 1 and the Upper Sharia Court 1 shall be open but only to handle urgent and time bound matters while strictly enforcing the physical distancing requirement.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
Anambra State government has directed civil servants in the state to work from their homes for the next 14 days from March 25. Ultimately, the policy extended until May 4th, 2020. 
 UPDATE: The Anambra State Government originally intended its stay at home order for civil servants to last only for 14 days. However, the order was ultimately only lifted on May 4th, 2020.

description: The Katsina State Government of Nigeria announced on March 26th, 2020 that civil servants should observe that day as a work-free day as a measure to prevent the spread of Coronavirus. The Katsina Head of Civil Service said that the government would review the situation in the next two days before announcing the next line of action. Ultimately, the government decided to have civil servants return to work on April 6th, 2020 to begin providing skeletal services.

Ultimately, the government decided to have civil servants return to work on April 6th, 2020 to begin providing skeletal services.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Other public facilities

description: The state of Oyo in Nigeria shut their State Secretariat on March 27 as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, and later reopened to staff on grade level 13 and above from Monday, April 27, would now be open to all other staffers from Monday, June 22. UPDATE: The State Secretariat, which was earlier shut on March 27 as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, and later reopened to staff on grade level 13 and above from Monday, April 27, would now be open to all other staffers from Monday, June 22.

description: The Katsina State Government of Nigeria announced on March 26th, 2020 that civil servants should observe that day as a work-free day as a measure to prevent the spread of Coronavirus. The Katsina Head of Civil Service said that the government would review the situation in the next two days before announcing the next line of action. Ultimately, the government decided to have civil servants return to work on April 6th, 2020 to begin providing skeletal services. UPDATE: Initially, the Katsina State Government directed civil servants to stay home indefinitely. However, they announced that on April 6, 2020, civil servants would return to work to begin providing skeletal services from the hours of 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. for the next week.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On April 13, Edo State Government has constituted mobile courts across the state to try violators of the measures put in place to prevent the spread of the coronavirus pandemic. The Chief Registrar of High Court of Justice said that "the police, state prosecutors and other stakeholders in the Criminal Justice sector of the state are by this notice invited to file their cases and prosecute violators of the provisions of the regulation in the designated courts in order to give full effect to the law."

description: The state government of Ekiti in Nigeria announced that "all non-essential workers in public and private sectors are encouraged to work from home" starting on March 23 but later announced that "at Grade Level 8 and above are to resume for duty from June 1, 2020, while those on Level 7 and below are to remain at home." UPDATE: The Ekiti State Government had previously encouraged all non-essential government workers to work from home, but the Governor announced that all workers "at Grade Level 8 and above are to resume for duty from June 1, 2020, while those on Level 7 and below are to remain at home"
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: Kwara State Technical Committee on COVID-19 pandemic on May 14 asked the Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Health, Ayinla Abubakar to proceed on indefinite suspension. The decision followed the mishandling of the evacuation of a man who locals said had locked himself in his vehicle for days and had become distressed following some personal life challenges. The state governor, Abdulrahman Abdulrazaq, approved the appointment of 10 new permanent secretaries (PS) to head various ministries, departments, and agencies of the government — barely two weeks after a crop of eight new PS were unveiled.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Kogi State government has set up a mobile court to try residents who violate a lockdown imposed on Kabba-Bunu local government area. On June 3, 2020, Chief Judge of Kogi State, Hon. Justice Nasiru Ajanah, CON, pursuant to the order of Kogi State Government locking down Kabba/Bunu Local Government Area due to the COVID-19 pandemic has constituted Mobile Courts for the trial of offenders under the Quarantine Act as applicable in Kogi state. Also, he has directed that all criminal cases pending before courts in the State before the advent of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) must be determined within the next three months.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On July 24, Kwara State Government announced the cancellation of Eid-ul-adha congregational prayers across the state, citing the steep rise in the state’s Covid-19 cases and the danger of such a large gathering worsening the situation. The Government also announced a ban on vigils in churches and mosques while restating the ban on concert, clubbing, beer parlour, and bar in hotels. description: On May 28, 2020 Nigeria's Anambra State Government signed the new COVID-19 Bill into law. Under this new Covid-19 Law it is an offense to be seen in the public without a face mask. The offense attracts a fine of ten thousand naira or some hours of community service.

description: The state government of Ekiti in Nigeria required the use of face masks in public beginning April 14 and strengthened the enforcement mechanism on June 30.. UPDATE: It was previously unspecified what the enforcement measures were and who would enforce the compliance, but the policy has changed. Now, "security agencies and Ministry of Justice have been directed to arrest and prosecute any person" who does not comply with the policy.

description: Residents of Kwara State must use face mask in public places, keep physical distancing or stay indoors beginning from Friday July 24th, the government announced on July 20, with the State Technical Committee's protective applications on COVID-19, nobody would be allowed into any public building, markets, malls, transport, banks, and so on without their proper use of the face masks as a safety measure to lessen the transmission of the virus.
type: Social Distancing
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: On July 31, With the rising number of confirmed cases of coronavirus (COVID-19) in Edo State, the government has urged residents to support efforts to contain the pandemic by observing social distancing and complying with all directives against the spread of the virus, including the compulsory use of facemasks and regular hand washing.
type: Social Distancing
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: By July 31st, 2020, the government would commence strict enforcement of the Kwara State Infectious Diseases Regulations 2020. Thenceforth, anyone seen outside without proper use of the face mask will be arrested, prosecuted in a mobile court, and taken to any of our quarantine centres. Their samples will then be taken and they will be held until their status is known. We want to emphasise that shop owners or business managers, drivers of commercial or private vehicles who allow persons without face masks into their shops or vehicles would be arrested alongside offending passengers and be taken to quarantine centres, have their samples taken and be held until their result is out.
type: Social Distancing
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
